data.title: Last 10 albums you listened to…physical media
data.meta_description:
Quatermass - s/t
Hard Stuff - Bulletproof
Hard Stuff - Bolex Dementia
John Gustafson - Goose Grease
Wally Waller - Kitchen Rock
Quicksilver - Shady...
data.text:
I’d never heard of ‘Goose Grease’ even though I love JG… especially Quatermass and Hard Stuff. I just ordered a cd copy. If you haven’t heard the Bullet- Entrance to Hell release I highly recommend it.

Dave Barker - Funkey Reggae 7" single

Beatles For Sale 1987 CD

REM - Life's Rich Pageant CD

Kingstonians - Lion's Den 7" single

Marylebone Beat Girls - 60s girls singers Ace CD compilation

Max Romeo - No No Joshua 7" single

The Velvelettes - He Was Really Sayin' Something / Needle In A Haystack 7" single

Francoise Hardy - 1972 album CD

The Specials Live at the Moonlight Club LP

Jackie Wilson - Higher and Higher 7" single

Unusually few LPs here, or even CD albums. That'll change soon. The 7" singles are because they came in a charity shop I volunteer in. There are plenty more to go through.

Zep – Houses of the Holy

John Mayer – Continuum

Beatles – Revolver (mid-80's Wally pressing, which I was A/B'ing against...)

Beatles – Revolver (BC-13 Harry Moss pressing)

Fleetwood Mac – Tusk (Had made a note that I needed a better copy and couldn't recall why...weird noise floor, turns out)

Chet Baker – Chet

Chet Baker – Plays Lerner & Loewe

Elvis Costello – This Year's Model

Roxy Music – For Your Pleasure

Pink Floyd – Wish You Were Here

Nice Thread, OP!

CDs:

Jeanette Lindström - Queen On The Hillside (Vocal Jazz, Sweden)

Tori Amos - Native Invader

Avishai Cohen with Nitai Hershkovits - Duende (Jazz: Double Bass & PIano)

Boney James - Detour (Jazz)

Annie Lennox - Songs Of Mass Destruction

Bïa - Coeur Vagabond (Latin Jazz, Bossa Nova/ Portuguese & French vocals)

Ryan Adams - FM

The Durutti Column - Keep Breathing (Avante-garde)

Brandee Younger - Brand New Life (New title: Release date: April 7. 2023. Jazz Harp, Soul-Jazz, Modern Creative)

The Pretenders - *Now & Then

The Pretenders – Now & Then

Label: Kiss The Stone – KTS 324

Format:

CD, Unofficial Release

Country: Italy

Released: 1994

Genre: Rock

Style: Pop Rock

Notes

The first 11 songs were taken from the Glastonbury '94 broadcast. Tracks 12-19 are from the Dominion Theatre in London, July 30, 1981.

Tracklist

1 Talk Of The Town

2 Hollywood Perfume

3 Money Talk

4 Don’t Get Me Wrong

5 My City Was Gone

6 Kid

7 I’ll Stand By You

8 Back On The Chain-Gang

9 Night In My Veins

10 Middle Of The Road

11 Mystery Achievement

12 Precious

13 The Wait

14 The Adultress

15 Message Of Love

16 Louie Louie

17 Day After Day

18 Bad Boys Get Spanked

19 Up The Neck

Notes

The first 11 songs were taken from the Glastonbury '94 broadcast. Tracks 12-19 are from the Dominion Theatre in London, July 30, 1981.

Last ten titles….mostly RSD obviously

1) Bill Evans : Treasures 3LP

2) Captain Beefheart : I’m Gonna Do What I Wanna Do 2LP

3) Miles Davis : Turnaround 1LP

4) Nuggets : 5LP Box Set

5) Jerry Garcia : How Sweet It Is 2LP

6) Grateful Dead : 5LP May 7, 1977

7) Strawberry Alarm Clock : Incense & Peppermints 1LP

8) Jimi Hendrix : Woodstock Performance 3LP

9) Jimi Hendrix : Blues 2LP

10) Jimi Hendrix : BBC 3LP

Yes it's his only true solo album - good varied stuff. I have the copy of Entrance when for some reason they were calling the band Daemon - see below. Also he recorded a rock and roll album called Rockall with a band called Rowdy in 1983 which included Ray Fenwick and Billy Bremner. I haven't been able to find a copy and it's not on Discogs but there are a bunch of songs from it on YouTube. There are also some unreleased JG demo tracks on YouTube like Scrape My Boot and Bumper to Bumper.
